subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: The former United States national team captain Claudio Reyna retired, less than two seasons after returning from Europe to join Major League Soccer’s Red Bulls. Reyna, who will turn 35 on Sunday, had been bothered by hamstring and back injuries this season that had limited his playing time. He said the injuries played a role in his decision. Reyna said he would stay with the Red Bulls in an advisory role, though he said details were still being worked out.
